title: Dealing With Family Loss - The GameOverGreggy Show Ep. 126 (Pt. 4)
description:
Tim Gettys explains how he deals with family loss.

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunny?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunny

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Greg - http://www.twitter.com/GameOverGreggy
Colin - http://www.twitter.com/NoTaxation
Tim - http://www.twitter.com/TimGettys
Nick - http://www.twitter.com/Nick_Scarpino
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Every day Greg Miller, Colin Moriarty, Tim Gettys, and Nick Scarpino talk about the biggest stories in nerd culture.

transcript_chunks.text: Tim yes what's your topic so I'm gonna throw it back to you Greg it's a topic from Patreon that's right Chris how do you pronounce his last name Zos, Zos, Zevos Chris Zevos supported us over on patreon.com Kinda Funny get his topic right in the air and here it is how would the Kinda Funny team deal with family loss or finding out a person you know has been diagnosed with a possibly terminal disease obviously everyone focuses on the sick person but it can really take a toll on the people around them I recently heard Brian Altano's mom was recently diagnosed so I looked to Brian to see how he handled the situation in a very public manner due to his job it must have been difficult but he also seemed supported by a great community my story is on GoFundMe.com Gloria and I'm sorry Zeos is that how you said it is Zvos I would say Z v a l o s my mom actually passed away since the last time we spoke it's destroyed our family because of the nature

So of course we encourage you if you can to go throw a few bucks that way.
